issue.title: Improve auditing for webapps
issue.body:
When using the Chrome Accessibility DevTools extension, pages such as [this Angular Todo](http://todomvc.com/examples/angularjs/#/) app will display severity issues that are not reported by A11y when conducting an audit.

Example: 
![](http://i.imgur.com/wROYEW7.png)

vs:

![](http://i.imgur.com/iCs2pet.png)

My current theory is that we're not giving the page sufficient time to complete JS execution so not all content is present and in an auditable state.

After experimenting with adding a custom timeout (similar to [this](https://github.com/kevva/screenshot-stream/blob/681d34fd0c5e9be0a894397e8d9a1f6841953810/lib/index.js#L156)) and playing with timeouts of differing values, this doesn't appear to improve our ability to report back on such issues.

These issues aren't specific to this module (as far as I can tell). I've been able to repro the same with https://github.com/GoogleChrome/accessibility-developer-tools. Looking into this further.

issue.title: CONTRIBUTING.md proposes to use "wrong" binary
issue.body:
In the step-by-step guide says `xcrun swiftc` should be used, but shouldn't it better be `xcrun swift`?

```bash
$ xcrun swiftc crash.swift 2>&1 | egrep 'swift.*0x'  | egrep -v '(PrintStackTrace|SignalHandler)' | head -1
```
vs.
```bash
$ xcrun swift crash.swift 2>&1 | egrep 'swift.*0x'  | egrep -v '(PrintStackTrace|SignalHandler)' | head -1
```

issue.title: Joomla changes component segments first dash/hyphen into colon.
issue.body:
#### Steps to reproduce the issue
Making a component's router: router.php.
In the function "parse(&$segments)" the segments have already been tampered with by joomla itself (while not after the build function which is not consistent).
E.g. **"my-personal-sef-url" becomes "my:personal-sef-url"**


#### Expected result
Since it is up to the component router to build the segments in the first place (by the build function) and thus his responsibility to make segments, Joomla should leave the segments sent afterwards to the parser alone. I am of course talking only about the segments targeted for this component and not the segments before that. Joomla can do what it wants with that.  

I know this probably has to do with slug or similar, but whatever the reason, this is forcing component developers to use that "concept" of routing.  This concept should be up to the component developer. 

But OK, if any developer doesn't agree with the above concept responsibilty, then one should be consistent and make it so that the segments returned by the build function are also changed accordingly after building them. Than at least for someone not knowing this concept, both functions in router.php are complying to each other.  

FYI:
This "bug" is already here since a long time it seems and people have changed the dash back to a colon in their routing.  (Isn't that a bit inefficient, and again inconsistent?).
Here is one example, but more can be found via google:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13471360/joomla-component-sef-links-on-and-jrequestgetvar-not-returning-variables-fro

issue.title: undefined method 'clear' for nil:NilClass in actionpack-4.2.0/lib/action_controller/test_case.rb
issue.body:
In some rspec before(:all) blocks it seems like the setup_subscriptions method in this file is not being called, resulting in the a nil instance_variable when reset_template_assertion is called.

more info can be found in this stackoverflow question

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27727786/rails-4-2-update-method-fails-only-when-called-from-beforeall-block

    def reset_template_assertion
      RENDER_TEMPLATE_INSTANCE_VARIABLES.each do |instance_variable|
        instance_variable_get("@_#{instance_variable}").clear
      end
    end

for now I just added a check to make sure the variable is not nil before calling clear on it, but I am not sure if the problem is that the setup_subsriptions __should__ have been call and was not.

    def reset_template_assertion
      RENDER_TEMPLATE_INSTANCE_VARIABLES.each do |instance_variable|
        variable_name = "@_#{instance_variable}"
        variable = instance_variable_get(variable_name)
        variable.clear #if variable
      end
    end

issue.title: Multiple logging channels
issue.body:
Add a config file named logging.yml, syntax very similar to that of Symfony 2.

```yml
channels:
  default:
    handlers: [main, syslog]

handlers:
  main:
    type: fingers_crossed
    level: warning
    handler: debuglog
  errlog:
    type: stream
    path: /var/log/my_application.error.log
    level: error
  debuglog:
    type: stream
    path: /var/log/my_application.debug.log
    level: debug
  syslog:
    type: syslog
    level: error
```

When injecting a logger into your classes, you don't want to type-hint the class that contains all the different logging channels, you just want to type-hint Psr\Log\LoggerInterface. Need to come up with a way to easily tell the container what channel you want without having to re-define the entire class factory - see #50

issue.title: pip install fails with latest setuptools version
issue.body:
A recent change in `setuptools` causes `nltk` install to fail (see https://github.com/nltk/nltk/issues/824).

Temporary workaround for users who have `setuptools>=10.0` installed in their python environment (default for all newly created environments using `get_pip.py`):

```
pip uninstall setuptools
# confirm with 'yes'
pip install setuptools==9.1

pip install -U textblob
```

Check for `setuptools version` in clean virtual environment:

```
pip list
pip (6.0.3)
setuptools (10.1)
```

issue.title: add is_unicode
issue.body:
Since `assertpy` does not support Python 3.x there is not much to do with unicode yet.  Add `is_unicode()` assertion so we can do something in 2.7.x:

```py
assert_that(u'fred').is_unicode()
```

issue.title: can you provide details of the relationship with Twilio ?
issue.body:
i'm just asking the question, it's not a "concern" of mine and i wouldn't be *too* bothered if that was a funding strategy, they provide a globally accessible infrastructure, they should get something for that i guess.

so the main question is this..
by using this service am i exposing my device as a potential SMS marketing target to Twilio or any other company that they have partnered with ?

i looked on the Twilio.com website for details because i'm getting the login code SMS messages in London, UK and i'm not being charged for them (as far as i can tell) which is normal, but somebody must be paying for them to be sent.. i guess.

again.. this is not something that would prevent me from using this service i would just rather know to expect some SMS messages instead of them just start arriving (e.g. from Coca Cola or other companies) without any advance warning.

thanks :-)

issue.title: AOBD Support
issue.body:
Not really a new request, as I already asked @satanicsanta and @ganymedes01 about it (https://twitter.com/ModdingAegisSrx/status/539452989187317760), but it's just to make an "official" request here and more or less shout to people interested in AOBD that support may come

Because it's basically changing the API so mods like AOBD can add ores to FSP's ore processing

issue.title: Forward security connections are ignored (don't even get tested)
issue.body:
I wondered why ciphertest didn't display any Diffie-Hellman ciphers. My installed version of GNUtls tells me that it does support them (just run `gnutls-cli -l`).
Comparing the outputs of https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/analyze.html?d=github.com with `ciphertest github.com 443` won't show any DH, only some AES- and ARCFOUR- ciphers.

issue.title: Unprefixed value is used if prefixed value is not available
issue.body:
Hi,

The following playground link should highlight this issue: http://play.golang.org/p/XHSJ8ihZh-

If MYAPP_USER is not defined but USER is, the value of USER will be used instead. This seems to be a side effect of https://github.com/kelseyhightower/envconfig/pull/10 , in https://github.com/kelseyhightower/envconfig/blob/master/envconfig.go#L51 we use fieldName as key without actually checking if a struct tag was actually set.

I can submit a PR for this but want to make sure the current behaviour is not intentional and this is not just a documentation issue.

issue.title: Cinnamon crashes on desktop load
issue.body:
Running Cinnamon 2.4.5 over a clean Ubuntu 14.10 x64 install on kernel 3.18.1-031801-generic. Cinnamon crashes when the user logs in as the desktop loads. Attempting to run `cinnamon --replace` from the terminal yields the following error:
```
(cinnamon:23306): Cjs-WARNING **: JS ERROR: GLib.Error g-invoke-error-quark: Could not locate gnome_desktop_get_media_key_string: 'gnome_desktop_get_media_key_string': /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcinnamon-desktop.so.4: undefined symbol: gnome_desktop_get_media_key_string
Window manager warning: Log level 32: Execution of main.js threw exception: JS_EvaluateScript() failed
```
Attempts to remove then reinstall cinnamon have not yielded any positive results.

issue.title: Should not set/use a default password for apt-acng
issue.body:
Providing default passwords is not such a good idea. We should force the admin to choose some password (even if he chooses "password" then). Best would be to not provide a default and *fail and stop processing this host* if the password is not supplied. 

Implementation:
* Change default to `""` (empty string) in https://github.com/htgoebel/ansible-apt/blob/master/defaults/main.yml#L91
* Remove fall back to default in https://github.com/htgoebel/ansible-apt/blob/master/templates/etc/apt-cacher-ng/security.conf.j2#L12 (these are useless anyway, because defaults are ensured to be defined in `defaults/main.yml`)
* Add a `fail` in https://github.com/htgoebel/ansible-apt/blob/master/tasks/configure_acng_server.yml#L5.
Haerbin.

 <git.RemoteReference "refs/remotes/origin/slash/test">,

>>> tree = repo.refs[0].commit.tree
>>> blob = tree / 'loremipsum.txt'
>>> blob
<git.Blob "93c8ff2243c4d2e9c63850d025a25ed38a51e623">
>>> blob.size
18804
>>> len(blob.data_stream.read())
18804
>>> blob = tree / 'saltstack.png'
>>> blob.size
7377
>>> len(blob.data_stream.read())
7377
>>> blob = tree / 'imagemagick_6.7.7.10-6ubuntu4_amd64.deb'
>>> blob.size
222318
>>> len(blob.data_stream.read())
221818
>>> blob = tree / 'archlinux_1080p.png'
>>> blob.size
778428
>>> len(blob.data_stream.read())
778428
```

Note that the .deb package's data stream is not the correct size (221818 instead of 222318 as it should be).

This doesn't seem to be related to the file size, as a larger PNG image works just fine. Both the PNG images and the .deb package are marked as binary files in the .gitattributes file, as well.

issue.title: Option to protect E2 code
issue.body:
I can't think of cases when anybody could want admins/owner or anybody else excluding, maybe, friends, to copy his e2 without any questions, requests, etc. Especially if he worked on it for months or even years... Yeah, there are some kind of ways to "protect", like adding "if(duped())...", "if(owner():steamID!="...")...", but they all are just too easy to overcome. Last month some of my e2s I was working on were copied for at least 4 times, and I don't wanna see them released by some thief poorly modified...
So, I am currently thinking of how can I protect my codes, and the best way I found is:
1. obfuscating e2 on client just before sending to server, 
2. including e2 code to protect from executing by another owner, encoded and hardly visible
3. making it impossible for owners/admins/anybody not allowed to read your code or dupe the e2

And I suggest adding (1) and (3) to wiremod (obfuscation can be optional in e2 settings). Also, think about adv.dupe. I think, owners and admins must be able to delete anything, but there must be no way to copy others stuff for them. And the harder it will be to overcome the better.

issue.title: Should be able to specify ssh key by fingerprint
issue.body:
When creating a droplet you should be able to give a key fingerprint to Droplet.create(). The current code tries to interpret any string as an actual public key.

Adding an additional check to see if it's a fingerprint, instead of a full public key, after finding a string in Droplet.__get_ssh_keys_id and then directly adding the fingerprint to the id list allows it to work.

issue.title: IntelliJ IDEA/Android Studio 使用指南
issue.body:
自从买了电脑之后，就没有配鼠标，大概是嫌弃鼠标不舒服，笔记本的触控版快被摸了，最近安装了Ubuntu，使用Android Studio 不是太卡了，体验还不错，今天在看官方文档翻到了Android Studio 的指南，索性就做点笔记，以备以后使用（特别是快捷键）；

因为Android Studio 是基于Intellij IDEA 开源版实现的，所以两者的快捷键基本上的都差不多，那就来说说如何使用基本操作；

## 工程和文件结构
![图片来自jetbrains](https://www.jetbrains.com/img/webhelp/uiEditor.png)

1. 文件编辑区域
2. 编辑区域左边（显示行号的）
3. 输入提示区域
4. 文档切换区域
     * ``Alt + Left`` 或者``Alt + Right``，不同的Tab 切换
     * ``Ctrl + Tab``：切换不同的区域
5. 其他功能区域（右边）


*新建文件或者插入方法*
``ALT + INSERT``（``COMMAND + N`` Mac）
- 在``编辑区``域是插入方法（构造方法，Get Set 方法等等）；
- 在``工程结构``新建文件

## 罗列一些常用的快捷键

全局快捷键（比较重要的） | |
----------| -----------------
ALT + ENTER| 工程快速修复
CTRL + SHIFT + A| 快速查找
CTRL + ALT + L (Win)| 格式化代码（我的锁屏的快捷键占了）
CTRL + Q (Win)| 查看文档
SHIFT + ESC | 当切换非编辑区域时，关闭该区域，返回编辑区域

编辑区快捷键|   |
----  |----
CTRL + B / F4 | 查看源码
CTRL + Q | 查看文档
SHIFT + ESC | 当切换非编辑区域时，关闭该区域，返回编辑区域
ATRL + / | 上下文联想
ALT + LEFT / RIGHT | 不同文档左右切换
ALT + TOP / BOTTOM | 跳转到上一个 / 下一方法


注释 | |
----  |----
CTRL + / | 注视当前行
CTRL + SHIFT + / | 文档注视


复制 / 粘贴|   |
----  |----
CTRL + C | 复制该行
CTRL + V | 粘贴
CTRL + X | 剪切
CTRL + Y | 删除该行

查找|   |
----  |----
Ctrl+Shift+A | 查找所有行为
Ctrl + F | 查找当前编辑的文档
Ctrl + R | 查找并替代
Ctrl + N | 查找类（class）
Ctrl + SHIFT + N | 查找文件



待补充。。。。。。




## 参考
- http://developer.android.com/tools/studio/index.html
- http://developer.android.com/sdk/installing/studio-tips.html
- https://www.jetbrains.com/idea/help/intellij-idea-editor.html
- https://www.jetbrains.com/idea/docs/IntelliJIDEA_ReferenceCard.pdf

issue.title: index には disqus を表示させない
Transforms, Bundles & Workflows - Thinking about npm, browserify, bower, webpack, etc...
issue.body:
Relates to #1, and partly a quick brain dump to wrap my head around all of these choices (so excuse me if it doesn't make sense right now)...

#### bower
- our current state of workflow.
- feels like a in-between of npm and wget. start with `bower.json`, `bower install` to download packages to `/bower_components/*` which we currently use to download codemirror & diff-merge-patch
- doesn't do anything else, we just load the components as static js assets
- development-wise we use the browser f5/refresh workflow
- bower components can be checked in to git

#### npm
- `npm install` downloads dependencies in `package.json` to `/node_modules`
- npm goes with hand-in-hand with node, they are node modules after all
- npm installed libs are typically not loaded directly from the browser, but would use something like browserify or webpack
- browserify and npm scripts is the current workflow for [timeliner](https://github.com/zz85/timeliner)
- node_modules not checked into git


#### require.js
- not to be confused require in node.js, it is a browser based module loader, although its offline optimizer can help create bundles too
- write modules in AMD style
- wasn't thinking of this approach for this project

#### browserify
- pretty powerful and useful for making node modules work in the browser
- our jscs is currently built with browserify
- typically use watchify if you like the "edit js files and refresh" workflow
- requires uglifyify for ulgified browserify transforms

#### webpack
- alternative workflow for the browserify workflow
- comes with development, watch and production mode builtin
- could support amd, commonjs, and normal js files
- can process css files too
- pretty customizable
- i'm pretty much inclined to try this

#### system.js, jspm
- universal dynamic module loader - es6 modules, cmd, commonjs, global scripts
- runs in the browser, so jspm needed for creating bundles
- jspm accepts npm/git repos

### gulp and grunt
- build tools with their own merrits but not planning to use them for this project

Broadly trying to categorize these tools, they can be thought to live more in the browser or on the filesystem (although distinction isn't always clear).

More browser-inclined
- bower
- requirejs
- systemjs

More cli based
- npm
- browserify
- webpack
- jspm
- gulp, grunt

I guess my choice right now is to try webpack, and decide whether to move shift bower back to npm or leave them alone.

issue.title: Should I make this module a plugin?
issue.body:
I made a colored `echo` based command; `msg` for a plugin I am currently working on. It could be useful to other users so I was thinking I should make it a plugin instead. Basically it can do something like this:

```
msg !! Error! -- Well, this is embarrassing...
msg ++ OK -- File ~~ $filename -- downloaded to :/ $directory
msg Visit → :// http://github.com
msg @orchid Dream @chocolate in @cornsilk Technicolor
msg Line1 == Line2 == Line3 ======= Line9
msg @random Only @random God @random Knows
msg @bad Bad @dad Dad @ff0 ":)"
msg _ Underline __ Bold ___ Underline and Bold FTW
```

![sample](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8317250/5555028/4817de3e-8ccf-11e4-93d4-3dd57e1f47bc.png)



Here is the `man` page. If you think this is plugin worthy I will submit a PR.

```
    __ _  ___ ___ _
   /  ' \(_-</ _ `/
  /_/_/_/___/\_, /
            /___/ v0.1.0

 NAME
      msg - technicolor message printer

 SYNOPSIS
      msg [-s] [-- -n --normal] [~~ -i --info] [_ -u --under]
          [__ -b --bold] [___] [++ -k --ok --success] [!! -e --error]
          [:// -w --www --url --mail] [:/ -d --dir] [== -l --line-break]
          [=== + \n][@<RRGGBB>] [<text>]

 OPTIONS
      -s
          Should be first if used. Do not separate arguments with spaces.

      -n
          Should be first if used. Do not output a newline at the end of
          the message.

 STYLES
      --   -n --normal              Normal/Default
      ~~   -i --info                Information
      _    -u --under               Underline
      __   -b --bold                Bold
      ___  -bu -ub                  Bold and Underline
      ++   -k --ok --success        Success
      !!   -e --error               Error
      ://  -w --www --url --mail    URLs, Emails, etc
      :/   -d --dir                 Directories
      ==   -l --line-break          Line Break
      ===                           +1 Line Break for extra =

      @<[RGB|RRGGBB|name|random]>
          RGB value can be a three/six hex digit or color name, e.g, @0fb
          @tomato, etc. Use @random to select a random color.

 AUTHORS
      @bucaran (Jorge Bucaran)

 v. 0.1.0
```

issue.title: `merge` should only keep the left-most value when multiple updates arrive simultaneously
An extended diff with upstream cblrepo.db
issue.body:
https://gist.github.com/nponeccop/94ad3aa0140634a287c9

It is modelled after `yaourt -Su`, but without colors and with two additional categories which should be empty until something bad happens to upstream:
```
==> Package upgrade only (new release):
haskell-core       GLUT                  2.5.1.1    4   ->  5
haskell-core       HTTP                  4000.2.19  2   ->  3
==> Software upgrade (new version):
haskell-core       JuicyPixels    3.1.7.1   5  ->  3.2.1     1
haskell-core       async          2.0.1.6   3  ->  2.0.2     1
haskell-core       auto-update    0.1.2     2  ->  0.1.2.1   1
==> Adopted packages (our RepoPkg in upstream)
haskell-core       appar       0.1.4     2  ->  0.1.4     1
haskell-happstack  fay         0.21.2.1  2  ->  0.21.2.1  7
haskell-happstack  fay-base    0.19.4.1  2  ->  0.19.4.1  9
==> Dropped packages (our DistroPkg not in upstream)
wai-extra   3.0.3  4
wai-logger  2.2.3  14
```
It's example output, `wai` isn't actually dropped from `core` :)

`/bin/printf` can be used instead of `column` to get consistent formatting across categories. And pacman -Sl can be used as version source instead of upstream `cblrepo.db` or in addition to them to provide extra sanity checks.

Feel free to put to `contrib/` if you don't find it useful for yourself.

issue.title: Performance, low-FPS
issue.body:
I have started a [post on the Pioneer Developers Forum](http://pioneerspacesim.net/forum/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=292) to track this and gather responses.

> Recently I've been hearing a lot of comments about the performance, as measured in FPS, in Pioneer having gotten much worse since the change to OpenGL 3.1
>
>What I would like to do is to quantify what's gotten worse and for whom. So if you could reply to this thread with some information that would be really helpful.

The last version of Pioneer with OpenGL 2.1 support can be found [via this link](http://pioneerwiki.com/wiki/FAQ#Previous_versions_of_Pioneer_.28pre_2014-11-19.29_used_to_work.2C_but_current_doesn.27t_start), please us it for comparisons with the current build of Pioneer.

When responding please include what Graphics card, CPU, RAM and Operating System you have, additionally for **Linux** users please tell me if you're using proprietary or Mesa/Gallium3D drivers.

Thankyou,

Andy

issue.title: Not Found response when mounting a Rack app into Lotus container
issue.body:
Given a container configuration:

```
Lotus::Container.configure do
  mount Web::Application, at: '/'
  mount ->(env) {[200, {}, ['Rack Four']]},  at: '/rack'
end
```

After starting server, perform a curl request:

```
curl -H Accept:application/json -H Content-Type:application/json http://localhost:2300/rack
```

Results in a `Not Found`.

Environment information follows.

```
ruby -v
ruby 2.1.5p273 (2014-11-13 revision 48405) [x86_64-darwin14.0]
```

```
bundle show
  ...
  * lotus-controller (0.3.0)
  * lotus-model (0.2.0)
  * lotus-router (0.2.0)
  * lotus-utils (0.3.2)
  * lotus-validations (0.2.1)
  * lotus-view (0.3.0)
  * lotusrb (0.2.0)
  ...
  * rack (1.6.0)
  * rack-accept (0.4.5)
  * rack-mount (0.8.3)
  * rack-test (0.6.2)
```

issue.title: Random Things Obsidian Stick conflict
issue.body:
If you try to make a Random Things Obsidian Stick (2 Obsidian in a vertical line in the crafting grid) it instead makes the WR-CBE Core version of the Obsidian Stick.

The issue is that the RT Spectre Sword requires the RT version of the Obsidian Stick in order to craft. So either one version needs a new crafting recipe, or the Spectre Sword needs to be ore-dictionaried so it can use either version.

issue.title: Make an installable package
issue.body:
- [x] Move `follow.py` to subdirectory `beetsplug/`. (see https://beets.readthedocs.org/en/latest/dev/plugins.html#writing-plugins)
- [x] Add `__init__.py` to `beetsplug/`.
- [x] Write `setup.py`/"create the project". (https://docs.python.org/2/distutils/setupscript.html, https://packaging.python.org/en/latest/distributing.html)
- [x] Optional: upload to PyPi. (https://packaging.python.org/en/latest/distributing.html#uploading-your-project-to-pypi)

And... I think that should do it. This will allow me to write an AUR package for this as well as for people to install via pip.

issue.title: spinning beach ball on open STL
issue.body:
When I open an stl file Slic3r becomes unresponsive. Cura can one that stl file.
Slic3r is version 1.2.4
OS is MacOSX 10.9.5 Build 13F34
STL was exported from Inventor Fusion 576.1.0
![screen shot 2015-01-01 at 16 13 47](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7612788/5592492/8f9ed372-91d2-11e4-9945-2776630c7c98.PNG)

issue.title: Specify female or male voice?
issue.body:
Thank you for sharing this. 
Is it possible to specify if the text is spoken by a female or male voice?

issue.title: 로딩 메시지 사용함으로 설정했음에도 XE 기본 로딩메시지가 뜨지 않음
issue.body:
로딩 메시지를 사용하는 것으로 설정했는데도 xe의 기본 AJAX 통신 메시지가 뜨지 않습니다.
댓글 작성시 DEFAULT 게시판에서 테스트했습니다.

CPAGE 이동이나 댓글 삭제시에도 새로고침이 되는 것이 약간 아쉬운 점입니다.

issue.title: OptaJoe January 01 2015 at 03:18PM
issue.body:
99 - Liverpool have now joined Chelsea on 99 Premier League penalty goals, more than any other club in the competition's history. Race.

— OptaJoe (@OptaJoe) January 1, 2015


January 01, 2015 at 03:18PM
via Twitter

issue.title: The results should only be visible after people have voted.
issue.body:
This is the first of the feedback from my father.

At the moment the triangle with the result is placed as soon as someone opens the page. This is confusing (especially because people do not know what the triangle means). Also if people were to understand the triangle it would have a bias effect, affecting how people voted. Also later in the voting process it was clear how my father did not realise he did not vote for all the proposals. So my suggestion would be to have all the proposals that need to be voted *before* the results. Then each proposal evaluated, once evaluated would disappear from before and appear under.

There are several enhancements that can be made following my father feedback, but this is a single simple one that would greatly enhance the experience, and make sure all proposals get voted.

issue.title: Stop bundling mpmath
issue.body:
```
Bundling mpmath causes problems for interoperation with user code and libraries using mpmath themselves (cf. discussions about this in issue 5259 ). It's also a problem for porting to Python3, as mpmath uses the same source under Python2 and 3, while we want to use 2to3, but no existing tool allows to mix the two approaches inside a single package.

So, I think that we should make mpmath an external dependency and remove it from our source tree. To specify the dependency properly, we'll need to port our setup.py to Distribute. I have a branch that does all this: https://github.com/rlamy/sympy/tree/unbundle-mpmath - it's not quite polished enough for a pull request but it works under tox (though not in python2.4, because mpmath 0.17 is incompatiblme with it).
```
Original issue for #5581: http://code.google.com/p/sympy/issues/detail?id=2482
Original author: https://code.google.com/u/101272611947379421629/
Referenced issues: #5259
Original owner: https://code.google.com/u/101272611947379421629/

issue.title: autofactory: don't make generated factories final
issue.body:
Currently generated factories are final. This makes them very hard (almost impossible) to mock (eg using mockito). A solution is to use a 'spy', however this requires to also provide all dependencies of the spied factory, making the test very messy.

solution: don't make generated factories final.

issue.title: Simplify the triangle icon that let people go to the voting triangle so they do not think it is meaningful
issue.body:
Every time my father wanted to open the voting triangle he would click on the small voting triangle in the question page next to a proposal, which would open the big triangle to vote. This is fine, but he would also try to click on the part of the triangle that represented what he wanted to say. On the green side if he agreed. On the red side if he disagreed. And so on. As those area are tiny it took him considerable time, for something that is pointless since the system was not storing this information at all. Only the vote on the big triangle counts. 
![screen shot 2014-12-21 at 17 55 12](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1333674/5518896/1355ed46-893a-11e4-81ee-2a53e23aada4.png)


Maybe simplifying this triangle so that it is not even divided. Maybe a smooth triangle would be better. With a message popping up: vote. Or just the words: "evaluate this proposal".

![screen shot 2014-12-21 at 17 59 11](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1333674/5518903/9f90191c-893a-11e4-82e1-57109baaa647.png)

PAC 远程URL / 本地PAC文本 相关问题

milestone.description:
* Options syncing
* Problems related to options syncing.
* UI Improvements and features like shortcuts

issue.body:
目标：保证切换到PAC情景模式尽量可以立即使用，同时也能保证PAC更新及时。

理想的实现方式：

1. 对于 `file:///` 的本地文件作为URL，直接使用。
2. 如果有下载好的本地文本，使用下载好的本地PAC文本。
 * 同时，尝试在后台下载 URL 。下载完毕后如果有更新，将新的PAC文本缓存到本地，重复步骤2。
3. 否则直接把 URL 丢给浏览器处理，可能会触发网络请求，有一定延迟。

issue.title: LQFP footprint pins have varying sizes
issue.body:
I was starting a new project with STM32L0 uC which comes in various packages (LQFP64 and LQFP48 both with 0.5mm pitch and LQFP32 with 0.8mm pitch). ST's documentation suggests that the pad size for 0.5mm pitch should be (0.3 x 1.2)mm and for LQFP32 it should be (0.5x1.2)mm.

Unfortunately the pad sizes in this library didn't match sizes suggested by ST and are pretty inconsistent:
* LQFP with 0.4mm pitch
  * LQFP-64 - (1.2x0.24)mm
  * LQFP-128 - (1.0x0.2)mm
  * LQFP-176 - (1.0x0.23)mm
  * LQFP-216 - (1.12x0.24)mm
* LQFP with 0.5mm pitch (STM32L0 datasheets suggests (1.2x0.3)mm pads for LQFP-48 and -64)
  * LQFP-32 - (1.2x0.28)mm
  * LQFP-48 - (1.3x0.25)mm
  * LQFP-64 - (1.0x0.25)mm
  * LQFP-80 - (1.5x0.28)mm
  * LQFP-100 - (1.5x0.28)mm
  * LQFP-128 - (1.5x0.28)mm
  * LQFP-144 - (1.55x0.3)mm
  * LQFP-160 - (1.1x0.285)mm
  * LQFP-176 - (1.12x0.3)mm
  * LQFP-208 - (1.5x0.4)mm
* LQFP with 0.65mm pitch
  * LQFP-36 - (1.0x0.43)mm
  * LQFP-52-1EP - (1.18x0.4)mm
  * LQFP-52 - (1.0x0.25)mm
* LQFP with 0.8mm pitch (STM32L0 datasheet suggests (1.2x0.5)mm pads for LQFP-32)
  * LQFP-32 - (1.2x0.6)mm
  * LQFP-44 - (1.6x0.56)mm
  * LQFP-64 - (1.5x0.6)mm

issue.title: rename "eos" argument? call for comments
issue.body:
Well, now’s the time to decide on this … should have done it a month ago …

The UNESCO-80 system had a good name.  It included whatever the committee wanted it to include. Some things were to do with the seawater equation of state, but other things were nothing to do with seawater, e.g. gravity.

By contrast, “TEOS” and “GSW” have names that connect to seawater and might (to some readers) imply a restriction to that connection. But — very helpfully — TEOS/GSW provide lots of other great functions also, again e.g. gravity.

My problem is that the scheme I have been using provisionally in “oce” is to let the user select between schemes with a parameter named “eos”. Well, that just seems weird for something like gravity.

I think I should have a new name for the argument.  There is not much problem doing this, because the code is stated clearly to be provisional and not for use by anyone other than the developers.  The question is … what should the argument be named?  Below are some things that come to mind. Do others have any thoughts? If so, please comment. I’ll illustrate with a call to the gravity function
	
	gravity(45, eos=“gsw”) # what we will have if I continue to use this arg name
	
	gravity(45, algorithm=“gsw”) # my preference; since this is R, people will likely write algo=“gsw” as an abbreviation

	gravity(45, method=“gsw”) # another good name


PS. adding the new version of gravity is not going to make a whole lot of difference, I think, e.g. at the surface and 45N:

	> gravity(45)/gsw_grav(45,0)
	[1] 0.9999989800493

issue.title: Person Attributes - Allow Descriptions to be shown for Defined Value field type?
issue.body:
When creating a new Person Attribute with a Field Type of "Defined Value", I select the Defined Type "Countries" to supply a list of possible values for the new Attribute.

When selecting a value for this Attribute in the Person Details screen, I am offered a drop-down list of two-letter country codes (representing the Value field of the Defined Value). What I really want the user to see is a list of the Descriptions (ie. the full country name) rather than the Values.

Two possible solutions to this are:
1. Always show a concatenated list of Value/Description in the drop-down list.
(eg. [AF] Afghanistan, [AX] Aland Islands).
2. Add an option to the Person Attribute definition which enables the list of Defined Values to be displayed as Value or Description (or Both?)

issue.title: IE11 on touchscreen laptop gives arguably false negative
issue.body: This is arguably a tricky situation, as even with the real MQ4 feature this is a grey area (though I seem to remember discussions about dynamically matching this depending on what the user actually uses): on a touchscreen Win8 laptop, maxTouchPoints is usually around 10, so it will identify this as a device that does not support non-emulated hover. However, the user can obviously be using the trackpad or attached mouse. It's more of a philosophical issue of: if the device can be seen as having two equally primary input modes (touchscreen AND trackpad/mouse), which one should match?

```
(master)test $ ./jtrts.pl -internal -q
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- JtR-TestSuite (jtrts). Version 1.13, Dec 21, 2014.  By, Jim Fougeron & others
- Testing:  John the Ripper password cracker, version 1.8.0.2-jumbo-1-bleeding_omp [linux-gnu 64-bit AVX2-autoconf]
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
form=osc                          guesses:    1 -show=   1 0:00:00:00 DONE : Expected count(s) (2)(-show2)  [!!!FAILED!!!]
Some tests had Errors. Performed 295 tests.  1 errors00:00 DONE  [PASSED]
Time used was 75 seconds
```
I didn't revert this JtR addition:
```
+ // repeat hash in the same form that is used in john.pot
+ {"$dynamic_4$05de5c963ee6234dc7d52f7589a1922b$ ", "welcome"},
```
Because I think it is a TS problem. (`./john --test` doesn't fail)

issue.title: Tags: priority in file name
issue.body:
To me, 'copyright' and 'artist' tags are more important. These should come first in the 'human' filename and other tags later.

1. Requires identifying what kind of tag each one is
2. All the servers have lousy tag APIs
3. Tag types need to be cached and incrementally updated (e.g. Gelbooru currently has over 310,000 tags: cannot fetch all at once)
4. Show the tag types in the tag lists

Tag flag 0: 'general'
Tag flag 1: 'artist'
Tag flag 3: 'copyright'
Tag flag 4: 'character'

issue.title: return URL is not preserved after login failure page reload
issue.body:
#### Steps to reproduce the issue

Setup a site with guest and registered type of users with a standard login access on a menu item. Non-registered users should be given guest permissions.
Define a menu item that can only be accessed with registered user rights.
Try to access this menu item by providing the URL directly without being logged in.
Now the login form should appear.

Try to log in with an existing user **but wrong password**.
You should get an error message.
Now try to log in with the correct password.

#### Expected result
You are redirected to the target menu link.

#### Actual result
You are **not** redirected to the target menu link.

#### System information (as much as possible)
Joomla 2.5.19, basic setup with guest and registered users

#### Additional comments
The reason for this is that the return URL which is passed in the form as a hidden input parameter is not preserved after reloading the login page due to the login error.

issue.title: Option to protect E2 code
issue.body:
I can't think of cases when anybody could want admins/owner or anybody else excluding, maybe, friends, to copy his e2 without any questions, requests, etc. Especially if he worked on it for months or even years... Yeah, there are some kind of ways to "protect", like adding "if(duped())...", "if(owner():steamID!="...")...", but they all are just too easy to overcome. Last month some of my e2s I was working on were copied for at least 4 times, and I don't wanna see them released by some thief poorly modified...
So, I am currently thinking of how can I protect my codes, and the best way I found is:
1. obfuscating e2 on client just before sending to server, 
2. including e2 code to protect from executing by another owner, encoded and hardly visible
3. making it impossible for owners/admins/anybody not allowed to read your code or dupe the e2

And I suggest adding (1) and (3) to wiremod (obfuscation can be optional in e2 settings). Also, think about adv.dupe. I think, owners and admins must be able to delete anything, but there must be no way to copy others stuff for them. And the harder it will be to overcome the better.

issue.title: Admin activation of users by email link not working if logged in to frontend
issue.body:
#### Steps to reproduce the issue

Set up user registration to require admin to activate new users. Login to frontend as administrator in your default browser. In other browser create a new user. Once you receive the "verification" link, at the new user email address, copy and paste the link in the other browser, not your default one (where you logged in with your admin user) Click on the activation link. 

#### Expected result

 When successful, we got the message "The user's account has been successfully activated and the user has been notified about it."

#### Actual result

The default browser just shows the site frontend without message that the user has been activated.

#### System information (as much as possible)

Joomla 2.5.28-dev

#### Additional comments

Initial issue Submitted By: Torben Wölm - Open Date: 2013-09-14 03:55:07
http://joomlacode.org/gf/project/joomla/tracker/?action=TrackerItemEdit&tracker_item_id=32007&start=0

I can reproduce the issue on 2.5.28-dev, it is still there. But it has been fixed in 3.3.x but with different PRs, revert from regression. Please help me to find what code should be back ported from 3.3.x, if possible, to fix this in 2.5.x!

milestone.title: 0.6.1 Release
milestone.description: These issues have to be fixed before we can release a 0.6.1 tag

issue.body:
Our updater is broken (or: I have strong suspicions it is).
According to `version-0.6.0`, we check the version present on FEX based on that file being listed on [this page](http://www.mathworks.de/matlabcentral/fileexchange/22022-matlab2tikz/all_files).

But that page no longer exists, as you can see. Either we need to find a different mechanism (e.g. we could use a similar mechanism on GitHub), or we may want to look for an alternative on FEX (e.g. 

Anyway, we still want to download everything through FEX: that link should still work, and it has the added advantage that we then keep track of our popularity in FEX.
Unfortunately, this situation also means that our end-users are currently unable to get notified of updates. However, we are still 7th most popular package with about 1200 downloads per month, so there is no reason for panic :smile:

issue.title: volos-swagger - add support to verifyToken in remote address
issue.body:
Hi,

In addtion to [#52](https://github.com/apigee-127/volos/issues/52), in a microservices architecture where one server responsible to the oauth2 and all the others are business logic only, there is need to verify the authenticated requests in a remote server. So there is need to tell swagger.yaml the url to verity the token.

I'm not sure how to configure this because the check if to verify in a remote address should be [here](https://github.com/apigee-127/volos/blob/master/swagger/lib/auth-middleware.js#L96) (I think so, not sure) but this lines are in use only when the oauth2 service is defined inside swagger.yaml inside x-a127-service, but, server with business logic only won't contain any of the volos-oauth-*provider*.

It seems like the best place is to add something like "verifyUrl" to the [securitySchemeObject](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-spec/blob/master/versions/2.0.md#securitySchemeObject) but maybe I'm missing something because I'm not expert in oauth2 authentication flows.

I'll be glad to hear your thoughts :)

Thanks,
Boris

issue.title: Idea: Backward harvest with Mex 5
issue.body:
Hello Courseplay team,

This idea began while testing #832 "Mais harvesting with poetinger mex 5" and the provided fix. As this is a new question/idea/request I decided to open a new "Issue" instead of placing this in the other thread.

With Mex5 attached at tractor front and using Courseplay v256 works now perfect.

I did a little research and found at Mex5 manufacturer home page (Pöttinger, see also links at the end) that it is also/more common to attach a Mex5 at the back of a tractor and then driving backward at harvest. I tried this configuration in LS 15 together with Courseplay v256... 

Initial the transport tractor driven by Courseplay joins the harvester in the "wrong" direction (screenshot 1). So I stopped Courseplay at transport tractor. Then I drove the transport manually to the "right" direction.  After I start Coursplay again at transport tractor the transport follows my backward driving harvester (screenshot 2) very good/as expected ;-) ... 

So my question: Is there an easy way to implement something like a "default backward/forward driving" flag to indicate the normal driving direction for such a harvest combine? So the transport would be able to evaluate such a flag and already initially joins in the "right" driving direction... 

Or is this just a nut idea from my side as this is not a very common usage of CP in LS 15?

Screen1
![fsscreen_2014_12_22_12_38_03](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5517105/5524609/1e2b3e44-89d8-11e4-9e7f-28a680940e8c.png)

Screen2
![fsscreen_2014_12_22_12_38_51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5517105/5524592/d48aa770-89d7-11e4-86ca-b9e57bbf9b5e.png)

Manufacturer info and movie:
http://www.poettinger.at/de_in/Produkte/Detail/420/mex-5-anbau-feldhacksler
http://www.poettinger.at/de_in/Newsroom/Video/hbk2sAEtbTI

Best Regards,
Martin

issue.title: Help of miniconda windows installer is missing doc for silent install mode
issue.body:
Hi,

I was using the Miniconda windows installer from http://conda.pydata.org/miniconda.html.

A windows with the following text shows up, when running `Miniconda-3.7.0-Windows-x86.exe /?`:
```
Usage Miniconda-3.7.0-Windows-x86.exe [options]
Options:

/InstallationType=AllUsers [default: JustMe]

/AddToPath=[0|1] [default: 1]

/RegisterPython=[0|1] [default: AllUsers: 1, JustMe: 0]

Examples:
Install for all users, but don't add to PATH env var:
Miniconda-3.7.0-Windows-x86.exe /InstallationType=AllUsers
/AddToPath=0

Install for just me, but register the system Python:
Miniconda-3.7.0-Windows-x86.exe /RegisterPython=1
```

This option list is missing the already! available options
```
/S

/D=C:\Miniconda
```
for silent install mode (unattended install mode) and the installation directory respectively.

Also the documentation on http://conda.pydata.org/miniconda.html, or http://conda.pydata.org/docs/index.html are not mentioning the command line options of the installer for conda / e.g. miniconda.

The only hint I could find was: http://docs.continuum.io/anaconda/install.html#windows-install.

issue.title: {{ . }} notation doesn't work with sets
issue.body:
The `{{ . }}` notation doesn't work for sets. Instead of iterate over data in set it will just call `str` function. Here is example of current behaviour:
```clojure
(render-string "{{# foo }} {{ . }} {{/ foo }}" {:foo #{1 2 3}})
```
will return:
```
" #{1 3 2} "
```
In this case I expect to get:
```
" 1  2  3 "
```

issue.title: Bookmark duplicates policy
issue.body:
When a bookmark is saved and user navigates on the same page and clicks on the address field star or chooses "Add bookmark" from the menu, a dialogue informs the user that such bookmark already exists. When the user chooses to continue from there, a new bookmark dialogue opens up. 

I have a suggestion to enhance this behaviour with an option in about:config AllowDuplicateBookmarks true/false. Both options would give the same warning as described, but when the duplicates policy is set to "false", the new bookmark dialogue would contain the existing bookmark data. 

I mean, when AllowDuplicateBookmarks is false, then selecting "Add bookmark" on a page already bookmarked, the user would see the existing bookmark edit dialogue, not adding a new dialogue. 

And the "This bookmark already exists. Continue?" dialogue should have three options: 1. Yes 2. Cancel 3. Never show this message again

And about:config should contain an option to get the dialogue back.

issue.title: Decouple from Grunt
issue.body:
We're at the point where a number of our most popular generators do not use Grunt. With this in mind, I think we should consider dropping or refactoring the messaging on our homepage to make it clear `yo` can be used to scaffold out a setup with any tooling choices.

Depending on how far we wanted to take it we could illustrate this point with examples.

E.g: 
Yo works great with Grunt. Check out generator-webapp.
Yo also works great with Gulp. Checkout generator-gulp-webapp.
It even works well with X, Y and Z which have nothing to do with either of these options.

If we decide to do this properly, we would also need to refactor the learning section of the site. Thoughts?

issue.title: check for valid misspelled keywords in models
issue.body:
Do we have a mechanism to warn the user that an argument passed to a model was not used?

A misspelled (nonexistent) argument simply disappears into *kwargs.

It is not easy to do automatically because we use `**kwargs` for cases when different classes handle parts of the keywords, eg. optional or required arrays in sub classes and `missing` and similar data handling in base classes. Additionally, we have the generic `from_formula` which has a different signature and keywords than `__init__`.

I guess the easiest will be to attach `valid_kwds` to a class, so we can check generically. We already added `init_keys` to be able to recreate a model which can be reused.

related: some other functions/methods also don't have a check for misspelled keywords. e.g cov_kwds in fit, plotting options ?

issue.title: rechoir.load() fails to require() module under certain circumstances
issue.body:
When doing

```
> node

> rechoir = require('../../index.js')  // from inside test fixtures
> rechoir.load('./test.coffee')
```

rechoir will fail to load the specified module. This is due to the fact that it does not first path.resolve() the specified filepath.

When doing ```require(path.resolve(filepath))``` instead, everything works fine.

issue.title: Biome Id's
issue.body:
Your Tropical Beach biome ID (value 55) cannot be configured via the configuration file, so this value collides with the default value from Biomes O Plenty for Deciduous Forest, which can be corrected by changing BOP's default value.  

Also, in the comments in the configuration file for the Dino Terrain biome ID, the details say that the mod adds only 4 Dino biomes, but there appears to now be 5 - Dino Plains, Dino Mountains, Dino Ocean, Dino Island with Dino Jungle as the latest it looks like.  So if using the default configuration values for biome ids, then Dino Jungle gets the value that the configs say is the first value for the IceAgeTerrain (46) and the 4th Ice Age biome (Ice Islands) is now at value 50, not 49 as the comments would make you think.

issue.title: OptimizePress Compatibility
issue.body:
OptimizePress is a WordPress theme and plugin that helps you create landing pages and sales pages. See http://www.optimizepress.com/. Several users have expressed frustration that s2Member's shortcodes don't seem to work properly.

For example, this simple Stripe shortcode, despite not having checkout options and despite the coupons field being disabled, are both shown on the page when this shortcode is placed on an OptimizePress-generated page:

```
[s2Member-Pro-Stripe-Form level="1" ccaps="main,expert1" desc="$97.00 USD / One Time (for lifetime access, non-recurring, no trial)" cc="USD" custom="domaindough.com" ta="0" tp="0" tt="D" ra="97.00" rp="1" rt="L" rr="BN" coupon="" accept_coupons="0" default_country_code="US" captcha="0" /]
```

OptimizePress does not have a free version, but anything we could do to improve compatibility between OptimizePress and s2Member would be great.

issue.title: Use of GPL licensed code
issue.body:
DrawKit contains GPL licensed code within the [framework/ThirdParty](https://github.com/DrawKit/DrawKit/tree/master/framework/ThirdParty) folder.

This code appeared in the original DrawKit archive. The code is optionally compiled into DrawKit using compile time preprocessor macros.

As the code is not essential to DrawKit, any GPL code should be migrated to other repositories or removed. This will simplify licensing.

issue.body: It would be great if you could incorporate a short code which allows for the customization of the CSS class for the link. Is there a realistic possibility this enhancement could be incorporated? Thanks very much for this fine plugin!

issue.title: `carthage fetch` for obtaining refs from an arbitrary remote
issue.body:
If I already have the repo in case on my hard-drive somewhere, it would be nice if Carthage could use that one, without me having to write a file URL into the `Cartfile` that may not be correct for other users.

Additionally, such a layer of indirection could make sure that old versions still check out cleanly even if the original URLs have long since rotted away. Decoupling the _what version of which depencency_ from _where to get it_ is pretty much my favorite thing about Cocoapods.

issue.title: CacheDecorator pro WebService
dist/material-styleguide.html doesn't load correctly [material-sprint]
issue.body:
In the material-sprint branch, the statically-built version of `material-styleguide.html` (i.e. the version in `dist/material-styleguide.html` created by `gulp`) usually doesn't load correctly from localhost--the main content frame appears to be blank.

To reproduce:

````sh
$ git checkout material-sprint
$ gulp
$ cd dist
$ python -m SimpleHTTPServer
$ open http://localhost:8000/material-styleguide.html # no content in main frame >50% of the time
````

This seems to happen if the browser is able to load the styleguide-demo iframes before sizeDemo() is [able to attach the onload handlers](https://github.com/google/web-starter-kit/blob/material-sprint/app/material-styleguide.html#L174), and so some are never called, which means the `demosLoaded` class is never added to `<body>`. (Which is more likely to happen if loading from localhost, without browser-sync being involved.)

issue.title: Windows: endless node_modules subdirs make backup IMPOSSIBLE
issue.body:
Congratulations to the node developers for finding the most effective way to ensure projects cannot be copied or backed up under Windows, by implementing and endless subdir method that ensures the path length at node_modules subdirs exceeds the path limit for Windows.

In over 20 years of using Windows, this is the second time I get this error. Maybe the developers do not use Windows, but don't forget that the entire world actually DOES use it, and preventing the user from making backups is not very nice from your part.

Please be so kind to implement a more reasonable approach that makes backups possible under ALL platforms, thank you.

issue.title: ICE due to dereferencing core::result::Result
issue.body:
# Code Example
this was taken from the intro doc, a few days ago. Notice that in the latest nightly you need to add a call to unwrap() after lock().

```rust
use std::thread::Thread;
use std::sync::{Arc,Mutex};

fn main() {
    let numbers = Arc::new(Mutex::new(vec![1i, 2i, 3i]));

    for i in range(0u, 3u) {
        let number = numbers.clone();
        Thread::spawn(move || {
            let mut array = number.lock();

            (*array)[i] += 1;

            println!("numbers[{}] is {}", i, (*array)[i]);
        }).detach();
    }
}
```

issue.title: Passing Streams as count arguments throws error
issue.body:
I have a PR ready for this, but it depends on #47 

Once that is good to go I'd be happy to submit it.

Basically, what is happening is that this line https://github.com/dockyard/ember-cli-i18n/blob/master/addon/rules/base.js#L7 is expecting a numeric value, but is getting a `SimpleStream`, which is throwing an error on https://github.com/dockyard/ember-cli-i18n/blob/master/addon/rules/base.js#L10

In addition, the Stream created in https://github.com/dockyard/ember-cli-i18n/blob/master/app/helpers/t.js#L31-L33 uses args created in https://github.com/dockyard/ember-cli-i18n/blob/master/app/helpers/t.js#L19-L24 which are themselves converted to Streams, but the parent Stream does not subscribe to changes in the argument Streams and is thus never re-rendered.

Ember's `#makeBoundHelper` handles this like so: https://github.com/emberjs/ember.js/blob/master/packages/ember-htmlbars/lib/system/make_bound_helper.js#L79-L87 which is basically what I did (though there are no key/value args passed to `t()` so that wasn't relevant

issue.title: endless loop in rrule.py
issue.body:
There is a bug in rrule.py (dateutil 2.3). The `while True` loop on line 659 does not always terminate:
```python
elif freq == HOURLY:
    if filtered:
        # Jump to one iteration before next day
        hour += ((23-hour)//interval)*interval
    while True:
        hour += interval
        div, mod = divmod(hour, 24)
        if div:
            hour = mod
            day += div
            fixday = True
        if not byhour or hour in byhour:
            break
```
Here's an example:
If the initial value of `hour` is an odd number, say `23`, and the `byhour` tuple is, e.g., `(0, 6, 12, 18)`, then we have an endless loop if `interval` is even because `hour` will always be odd and, hence, `hour in byhour` is never `True`!

Because dateutil is used by matplotlib, this causes some plotting routines to freeze.

issue.title: Configuration of static backend should deny setups known to create issues
issue.body:
The configuration option of the 'static backend' should not only reflect the resulting URL namespace (as it already does), but also deny such setups that are known to create issues. 

* configuring the base URL to point to exactly that folder where the OC code is installed
* configuring the base URL to point to a folder containing any physical files/folders

The reason here is potential name conflict with existing files/folders.

issue.title: States don't seem to work properly anymore
Gradle: Could not find element /manifest/application.
issue.body:
Hi,

I've been trying to add this library as a gradle dependency of my project, but gradle is enable to merge manifest files correctly, giving me the above error.

I've been looking around and it seems that even for a library project, the associated  AndroidManifest.xml needs an empty \<application />

This is a workaround as stated here: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/adt-dev/wFnAOAmYCSs

I'm not sure about what to do about it, either wait for a fix in Gradle, or publish a new version with the missing tag. This is up to you guys.

I'm using IntellijIDEA 13.1.4 with the included gradle wrapper plugin.

Cheers,

AL.

PS: if by any chance I'm missing something, any help will be appreciated

issue.title: Choose a license
issue.body:
Right now, ServeSimple doesn't have a license. That's not because there aren't enough to choose from.

With ServeSimple, I mostly care about keeping it free. I don't know much about the legalities, but I do know enough to realize that "free" means different things to different people. Free to modify and keep closed if someone wishes (MIT-ish) or free and always remaining open (GPL-ish). Seems more like philosophy than law. (Although [maybe everything leads there eventually](http://flowingdata.com/2011/06/08/all-roads-lead-to-philosophy-on-wikipedia/)?)

Since I intend to offer free hosting of ServeSimple, I think the biggest thing I want to prevent is someone else charging a non-profit for hosting an instance ServeSimple as ServeSimple. (But, maybe that's not such a big deal? Argh!)

As this is a free project, we'll want to leverage as much third-party and quality software that already exists. Does choosing one path or another restrict our use of key components?

Some options:

* MIT/Apache
* GPL

Cheers :)

issue.title: Add RabbitMQ monitor to alert when count(channel) > count(connection)
issue.body:
Having any RabbitMQ connection servicing more than a single channel indicates a problem with agent <-> RabbitMQ communication.  We need an alert any time this occurs.

Expected behavior:
```
# rabbitmqctl list_connections channels | sort -n | tail -n1 
1
```

Indicates a problem:
```
# rabbitmqctl list_connections channels | sort -n | tail -n1 
186833
```

issue.body:

issue.body: What versions are being used? Seems like 1.0.1 isn't: https://github.com/flaub/openssl-net/issues/4 and hence we aren't supporting TLS1.1, TLS1.2 or authenticated TLS like GCM or perfect forward secrecy.

issue.title: de-select (reset) multiselection fields
issue.body:
Talking about $eventData['properties']['ep_disable_markup_* 

I just discovered being unable to reset an already selected disabled markup plugin via the entryforms entryproperties markup hook. (It is not a javascript issue!)

1. Edit entry with CKEDITOR and disable nl2br via multiselect
2. Save your entry
3. Via sidebar get entries request call this entry again and de-select the multiselect selection ([CTRL]+marked option)
3. Save your entry
4. Via sidebar get entries request, call this entry again and see the multiselect has not changed.

I already have a full working proposel adding a NONE constant reset option field for this, if it has selected options, but maybe this will happen to us on more places too....?!

Anybody for this?
